title: Requires every school to have at least one person certified in CPR and first aid while pupils are present

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2276

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the education law, in relation to requiring every school to
have at least one person certified in cardiopulmonary resuscitation and
first aid present while pupils are in attendance

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:

The purpose of this legislation is to insure that added protections
are afforded students, while they attend school, from the hazards of
choking and other preventable medical emergencies.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISION:

Section 1 amends the education law by adding a new Section 921 which
directs schools to have present at all times during which pupils are
present at least one person certified in cardiopulmonary
resuscitation and first aid; outlines the requirements to be
established by the Commissioner of Education for certification in CPR
and first aid; notes that this law will not supersede any other
provision in health or education law relative to health education or
school nurses.

Section 4 is the enacting clause.

EXISTING LAW:

Existing law does not require personnel trained in CPR and first aid
to be done on premises during school hours.

JUSTIFICATION:

Several recent medical incidents involving students in New York
State's public schools have been exacerbated by the absence of
personnel in schools who are trained in CPR and first aid. A few
students have died as a result of choking incidents; these incidents
may not have ended so tragically if trained help was on hand in the
school building.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

Implementation of the provisions of this legislation is contingent
upon availability of funding through grants, contributions and other
sources.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

The first of January after it has become a law, provided, however,
that those rules and regulations necessary to effectuate the
provisions of this act shall be promulgated before such date.
